sentence: From here on the Widmark character turns unintentionally comical!

sentence: His losing his marbles so early in the proceedings is totally implausible and unconvincing.

sentence: steve martin delivers a really funny performance of a middle-aged, upper class, uptight white guy.

sentence: add betty white and jean smart and you have a great cast - everyone played their parts really well.

sentence: but the movie makes a lot of serious mistakes.

sentence: first of all, there are enough racial stereotypes and racial jokes to offend everyone.

sentence: putting the race card aside, lets look at the major flaw in the film: they destroy latifa's character.

The sentiment is well-supported and the confidence rating is high.

sentence: there is no real plot.

sentence: STEAMBOAT WILLIE is an amazingly important film to our cinema history.

sentence: This second appearance of Mickey Mouse (following the silent PLANE CRAZY earlier that year) is probably his most famous film--mostly because it was so ground-breaking.

sentence: While you don't yet hear Mickey speak, there are tons of sound effects and music throughout the film--something we take for granted now but which was a huge crowd pleaser in 1928.
explanation: The prompt highlights the positive aspect of the film, emphasizing the presence of sound effects and music, which were well-received and enjoyed by the crowd in 1928. Overall, the sentiment towards the film is positive.

sentence: However, after seeing the short again after about 25 years, I was amazed at how timeless the film actually is.

sentence: It's just adorable seeing Mickey playing "Turkey in the Straw" in a highly imaginative (if occasionally cruel) way.

sentence: Clever and a real crowd-pleaser--this film still ranks among Mickey's best films even after 80 wonderful years.

sentence: The bipolarity of the ruthless thug (one minute a ruthless killer, the next minute a Luv's diaper commercial) is completely unconvincing.

sentence: I'm terribly disappointed that this film would receive so many awards and accolades, especially when there are far more deserving works of film out there.
